medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been experiencing kinetic tremors, dysarthria, and personality change since 2017 without any treatment. He reported 4 weeks of binocular vision blurring associated with progressive slow reaction, unsteady walking, executive dysfunction, and declined mental status. Symptoms were aggravated by his condition and he presented with photophobia or tearing without pain during eye movements.
medical_history.family_history: The patient had no known family history of any ophthalmologic, neurologic, or hepatic diseases.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a 22-year-old male smoker who consumes 10-20 cigarettes per day. He denied anti-obesity, alcohol, herbals, or illicit drug use before entering the hospital.
